title: Increased D drives up short run price for gadgets

content.question: A constant-cost, perfectly competitive gadget industry is in long-run equilibrium. An increase in the number of consumers of gadgets will most likely result in

choices.label: higher short-run and long-run prices for gadgets
reduced short-run profits, followed by the exit of some firms
an upward shift in all short-run cost curves, followed by a higher long-run price for gadgets
a higher short-run price for gadgets, followed by an increase in the quantity produced
a decrease in the demand for gadgets, followed by a decrease in the supply of gadgets

content.answer: a higher short-run price for gadgets, followed by an increase in the quantity produced
